message.content:
cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.CG, cs.PL

Reasoning: The paper deals with algorithms for generating all n-tuples over an alphabet of m letters, which is a problem in discrete mathematics and computer science. The connection with variations of the Towers of Hanoi game suggests that the paper may belong to the sub-category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) or cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics). The mention of hardware implementation suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of cs.CC (Computational Complexity) or cs.CG (Computational Geometry). Finally, the mention of working ahead and saving the work in a buffer suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of cs.PL (Programming Languages).
